subject: Photography
title: Red: Power and Passion
description: A quick, practical guide to Red: Power and Passion.

hook.text: Red means stop. Red means love. Red means danger. No color carries more emotional weight.

buildup.text: Red is the most visually dominant color. It advances toward the viewer and demands attention.

discovery.text: Studies show red increases heart rate and stimulates appetite. Restaurants use it deliberately.

twist.text: Red's meaning shifts by culture. In the West it signals danger and passion. In China it represents luck and joy.

climax.text: In photography, a single red element can anchor an entire composition and dominate the viewer's eye.

punchline.text: Red doesn't ask for attention. It takes it.

quiz.question: Why is red the most dominant color in photographs?
options: It visually advances toward the viewer and demands attention
It's the most common color in nature
